00025 #ifndef INCLUDE_git_tag_h__
00026 #define INCLUDE_git_tag_h__
00027 
00028 #include "common.h"
00029 #include "types.h"
00030 #include "oid.h"
00031 #include "object.h"
00032 
00033 /**
00034  * @file git2/tag.h
00035  * @brief Git tag parsing routines
00036  * @defgroup git_tag Git tag management
00037  * @ingroup Git
00038  * @{
00039  */
00040 GIT_BEGIN_DECL
00041 
00042 /**
00043  * Lookup a tag object from the repository.
00044  *
00045  * @param tag pointer to the looked up tag
00046  * @param repo the repo to use when locating the tag.
00047  * @param id identity of the tag to locate.
00048  * @return 0 on success; error code otherwise
00049  */
00050 GIT_INLINE(int) git_tag_lookup(git_tag **tag, git_repository *repo, const git_oid *id)
00051 {
00052         return git_object_lookup((git_object **)tag, repo, id, (git_otype)GIT_OBJ_TAG);
00053 }
00054 
00055 /**
00056  * Close an open tag
00057  *
00058  * This is a wrapper around git_object_close()
00059  *
00060  * IMPORTANT:
00061  * It *is* necessary to call this method when you stop
00062  * using a tag. Failure to do so will cause a memory leak.
00063  *
00064  * @param tag the tag to close
00065  */
00066 
00067 GIT_INLINE(void) git_tag_close(git_tag *tag)
00068 {
00069         git_object_close((git_object *) tag);
00070 }
00071 
00072 
00073 /**
00074  * Get the id of a tag.
00075  *
00076  * @param tag a previously loaded tag.
00077  * @return object identity for the tag.
00078  */
00079 GIT_EXTERN(const git_oid *) git_tag_id(git_tag *tag);
00080 
00081 /**
00082  * Get the tagged object of a tag
00083  *
00084  * This method performs a repository lookup for the
00085  * given object and returns it
00086  *
00087  * @param target pointer where to store the target
00088  * @param tag a previously loaded tag.
00089  * @return 0 on success; error code otherwise
00090  */
00091 GIT_EXTERN(int) git_tag_target(git_object **target, git_tag *t);
00092 
00093 /**
00094  * Get the OID of the tagged object of a tag
00095  *
00096  * @param tag a previously loaded tag.
00097  * @return pointer to the OID
00098  */
00099 GIT_EXTERN(const git_oid *) git_tag_target_oid(git_tag *t);
00100 
00101 /**
00102  * Get the type of a tag's tagged object
00103  *
00104  * @param tag a previously loaded tag.
00105  * @return type of the tagged object
00106  */
00107 GIT_EXTERN(git_otype) git_tag_type(git_tag *t);
00108 
00109 /**
00110  * Get the name of a tag
00111  *
00112  * @param tag a previously loaded tag.
00113  * @return name of the tag
00114  */
00115 GIT_EXTERN(const char *) git_tag_name(git_tag *t);
00116 
00117 /**
00118  * Get the tagger (author) of a tag
00119  *
00120  * @param tag a previously loaded tag.
00121  * @return reference to the tag's author
00122  */
00123 GIT_EXTERN(const git_signature *) git_tag_tagger(git_tag *t);
00124 
00125 /**
00126  * Get the message of a tag
00127  *
00128  * @param tag a previously loaded tag.
00129  * @return message of the tag
00130  */
00131 GIT_EXTERN(const char *) git_tag_message(git_tag *t);
00132 
00133 
00134 /**
00135  * Create a new tag in the repository from an OID
00136  *
00137  * @param oid Pointer where to store the OID of the
00138  *      newly created tag
00139  *
00140  * @param repo Repository where to store the tag
00141  *
00142  * @param tag_name Name for the tag; this name is validated
00143  * for consistency. It should also not conflict with an 
00144  * already existing tag name
00145  *
00146  * @param target OID to which this tag points; note that no
00147  *      validation is done on this OID. Use the _o version of this
00148  *      method to assure a proper object is being tagged
00149  *
00150  * @param target_type Type of the tagged OID; note that no
00151  *      validation is performed here either
00152  *
00153  * @param tagger Signature of the tagger for this tag, and
00154  *  of the tagging time
00155  *
00156  * @param message Full message for this tag
00157  *
00158  * @return 0 on success; error code otherwise.
00159  *      A tag object is written to the ODB, and a proper reference
00160  *      is written in the /refs/tags folder, pointing to it
00161  */
00162 GIT_EXTERN(int) git_tag_create(
00163                 git_oid *oid,
00164                 git_repository *repo,
00165                 const char *tag_name,
00166                 const git_oid *target,
00167                 git_otype target_type,
00168                 const git_signature *tagger,
00169                 const char *message);
00170 
00171 
00172 /**
00173  * Create a new tag in the repository from an existing
00174  * `git_object` instance
00175  *
00176  * This method replaces the `target` and `target_type`
00177  * paremeters of `git_tag_create` by a single instance
00178  * of a `const git_object *`, which is assured to be
00179  * a proper object in the ODB and hence will create
00180  * a valid tag
00181  *
00182  * @see git_tag_create
00183  */
00184 GIT_EXTERN(int) git_tag_create_o(
00185                 git_oid *oid,
00186                 git_repository *repo,
00187                 const char *tag_name,
00188                 const git_object *target,
00189                 const git_signature *tagger,
00190                 const char *message);
00191 
00192 /**
00193  * Create a new tag in the repository from a buffer
00194  *
00195  * @param oid Pointer where to store the OID of the newly created tag
00196  *
00197  * @param repo Repository where to store the tag
00198  *
00199  * @param buffer Raw tag data
00200  */
00201 GIT_EXTERN(int) git_tag_create_frombuffer(
00202                 git_oid *oid,
00203                 git_repository *repo,
00204                 const char *buffer);
00205 
00206 /**
00207  * Create a new tag in the repository from an OID
00208  * and overwrite an already existing tag reference, if any.
00209  *
00210  * @param oid Pointer where to store the OID of the
00211  *      newly created tag
00212  *
00213  * @param repo Repository where to store the tag
00214  *
00215  * @param tag_name Name for the tag; this name is validated
00216  * for consistency.
00217  *
00218  * @param target OID to which this tag points; note that no
00219  *      validation is done on this OID. Use the _fo version of this
00220  *      method to assure a proper object is being tagged
00221  *
00222  * @param target_type Type of the tagged OID; note that no
00223  *      validation is performed here either
00224  *
00225  * @param tagger Signature of the tagger for this tag, and
00226  *  of the tagging time
00227  *
00228  * @param message Full message for this tag
00229  *
00230  * @return 0 on success; error code otherwise.
00231  *      A tag object is written to the ODB, and a proper reference
00232  *      is written in the /refs/tags folder, pointing to it
00233  */
00234 GIT_EXTERN(int) git_tag_create_f(
00235                 git_oid *oid,
00236                 git_repository *repo,
00237                 const char *tag_name,
00238                 const git_oid *target,
00239                 git_otype target_type,
00240                 const git_signature *tagger,
00241                 const char *message);
00242 
00243 /**
00244  * Create a new tag in the repository from an existing
00245  * `git_object` instance and overwrite an already existing 
00246  * tag reference, if any.
00247  *
00248  * This method replaces the `target` and `target_type`
00249  * paremeters of `git_tag_create_f` by a single instance
00250  * of a `const git_object *`, which is assured to be
00251  * a proper object in the ODB and hence will create
00252  * a valid tag
00253  *
00254  * @see git_tag_create_f
00255  */
00256 GIT_EXTERN(int) git_tag_create_fo(
00257                 git_oid *oid,
00258                 git_repository *repo,
00259                 const char *tag_name,
00260                 const git_object *target,
00261                 const git_signature *tagger,
00262                 const char *message);
00263 
00264 /**
00265  * Delete an existing tag reference.
00266  *
00267  * @param repo Repository where lives the tag
00268  *
00269  * @param tag_name Name of the tag to be deleted;
00270  * this name is validated for consistency.
00271  *
00272  * @return 0 on success; error code otherwise.
00273  */
00274 GIT_EXTERN(int) git_tag_delete(
00275                 git_repository *repo,
00276                 const char *tag_name);
00277 
00278 /** @} */
00279 GIT_END_DECL
00280 #endif
